subject: Golf
Athletics and Sports
lead_paragraph: Two college golfers and a Long Islander in his mid-20s led after the first round of the Metropolitan Golf Association’s Ike Championship at Fenway Golf Club in Scarsdale. Larry Haertel Jr. of Greenwich, the 2006 Ivy League champion from Brown; John Murphy of Brooklawn, who plays at Old Dominion; and Andreas Huber of Garden City Golf Club, the 2007 Long Island Amateur runner-up, had scores of two-over 72 to lead the field of 104 players. The four-time champion George Zahringer III was a stroke back at 73. Andrew Giuliani, the 2005 champion, shot a 76.
